H0.text: what type of government did mexico have. Constitutional Monarchy

H1.text: what type of government did mexico have. Parliamentary Democracy

H2.text: what type of government did mexico have. Presidential System

H3.text: what type of government did mexico have. Federal republic

A4.text: The Mexican federal government has three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial and functions per the Constitution of the United Mexican States, as enacted in 1917, and as amended.

A5.text: The President of the United Mexican States is the head of the executive branch of the country. They are also the head of state, the head of government, and the supreme commander of the Armed Forces.

A6.text: Most federal republics codify the division of powers between orders of government in a written constitutional document.

A7.text: A federal republic is a federation of states with a republic as a form of government.

A8.text: This constitutional form of government continued until the monarchy was overthrown in an 1893 coup.
